CustomerService.purpose: Manages comprehensive customer master data including business partner demographics, contact information, credit limits, payment terms, and business relationships. Handles customer onboarding, credit verification, contact management, and customer lifecycle processes for all business partners including prospects, active customers, and inactive accounts.

Customer.description: Core customer business partner entity containing complete customer profile including financial details, business classification, and relationship management data used for sales, credit, and customer service operations

fields.CustomerID: Unique customer identifier used for customer lookups, order references, and linking customer data across all business processes and systems
fields.CompanyName: Legal business name of the customer organization used for contracts, invoicing, and official correspondence
fields.CreditLimit: Maximum approved credit amount for customer transactions, used for order approval, credit checks, and financial risk management
fields.ContactEmail: Primary business email address for customer communication, order confirmations, and business correspondence
fields.PaymentTerms: Standard payment terms and conditions defining payment due dates, early payment discounts, and collection procedures
fields.CustomerType: Business classification such as retail, wholesale, enterprise, or government customer used for pricing and service level determination
fields.Industry: Business sector classification including manufacturing, retail, services, or technology used for market analysis and targeted marketing
fields.AccountManager: Assigned sales representative or account manager responsible for customer relationship and sales activities

CustomerAddress.description: Customer address information including billing addresses, shipping addresses, and mailing addresses used for order fulfillment, invoicing, and customer communication

fields.AddressID: Unique address identifier used to reference specific customer addresses in orders and deliveries
fields.CustomerID: Reference to the customer this address belongs to, linking addresses to customer records
fields.AddressType: Type of address such as billing address, shipping address, or mailing address used for order processing and communication
fields.Street: Street address including building number and street name used for deliveries and correspondence
fields.City: City name used for shipping calculations, tax determination, and regional analysis
fields.PostalCode: Postal or ZIP code used for shipping, tax calculations, and geographic analysis
fields.Country: Country code used for international shipping, tax compliance, and regional business rules

SalesOrderService.purpose: Handles comprehensive sales order processing including order creation, modification, tracking, line item management, pricing, delivery scheduling, and order fulfillment status. Manages the complete sales order lifecycle from quotation through delivery and invoicing including order approvals, inventory allocation, and customer communication.

SalesOrder.description: Sales order header containing complete order information including customer details, order totals, delivery information, and order status used for order processing, fulfillment, and customer service

fields.OrderID: Unique sales order number used for order tracking, customer inquiries, and referencing orders across all business processes
fields.CustomerID: Reference to the customer who placed the order, used for customer service, billing, and order history
fields.OrderDate: Date when the sales order was created, used for order processing timelines and performance analysis
fields.OrderStatus: Current processing status such as open, confirmed, shipped, or delivered used for order tracking and customer updates
fields.TotalAmount: Total monetary value of the sales order including taxes and shipping used for financial reporting and credit checks
fields.DeliveryDate: Requested or confirmed delivery date used for logistics planning and customer communication
fields.SalesRep: Sales representative who created or manages the order used for commission calculation and customer relationship management
fields.OrderType: Classification of order such as standard order, rush order, or bulk order used for processing priorities and fulfillment procedures
fields.ShippingAddress: Delivery address for the order used for logistics and shipping calculations
fields.BillingAddress: Invoicing address used for billing and payment processing

SalesOrderItem.description: Individual line items within sales orders containing product details, quantities, pricing, and line-specific information used for inventory allocation, pricing, and order fulfillment

fields.ItemID: Unique line item identifier within the order used for referencing specific products in the order
fields.OrderID: Reference to the parent sales order linking line items to order headers
fields.ProductID: Reference to the product being ordered used for inventory checks and product information
fields.Quantity: Number of units ordered for this product used for inventory allocation and shipping
fields.UnitPrice: Price per unit for the product including any customer-specific pricing or discounts
fields.LineTotal: Total amount for this line item calculated from quantity and unit price
fields.DiscountPercent: Discount percentage applied to this line item based on customer agreements or promotions
fields.DeliveryDate: Requested delivery date for this specific line item used for partial shipment planning
fields.ItemStatus: Status of this line item such as open, allocated, shipped, or delivered

InventoryService.purpose: Manages comprehensive inventory and product catalog including stock levels, product information, pricing, warehouse locations, inventory movements, and reorder management. Handles product master data, stock tracking, inventory transactions, and availability checking for sales and procurement processes.

Product.description: Product master data containing complete product information including specifications, pricing, inventory levels, and supplier information used for sales, purchasing, and inventory management

fields.ProductID: Unique product identifier used for product lookups, ordering, and inventory tracking across all systems
fields.ProductName: Display name and description of the product used for sales presentations and customer communication
fields.Category: Product category classification such as electronics, clothing, or industrial supplies used for reporting and catalog organization
fields.StockQuantity: Current available inventory level used for order fulfillment and availability checking
fields.ReorderLevel: Minimum stock level that triggers reordering used for procurement planning and stock management
fields.UnitPrice: Standard selling price per unit used for quotations and order pricing
fields.Supplier: Primary supplier or vendor for this product used for procurement and supplier management
fields.WarehouseLocation: Physical storage location in warehouse used for picking and inventory management
fields.ProductDescription: Detailed product specifications and features used for sales and customer information
fields.UnitOfMeasure: Unit of measurement such as pieces, kilograms, or liters used for inventory and ordering

StockMovement.description: Inventory transaction records tracking all stock movements including receipts, issues, transfers, and adjustments used for inventory control and audit trails

fields.MovementID: Unique transaction identifier for tracking individual inventory movements and audit purposes
fields.ProductID: Reference to the product involved in the movement linking transactions to product records
fields.MovementType: Type of inventory transaction such as receipt, issue, transfer, or adjustment used for categorizing movements
fields.Quantity: Quantity of product moved in this transaction using the product's unit of measure
fields.MovementDate: Date and time when the inventory movement occurred used for chronological tracking
fields.Warehouse: Warehouse or storage location where the movement took place used for location-specific inventory
fields.Reference: Reference document such as purchase order, sales order, or transfer order that caused the movement
fields.Reason: Reason for the movement such as sale, purchase, transfer, or adjustment used for analysis and reporting
